title: Chaotic
data:
***Version [0.30](/0.30 "0.30")**: This article **may not be** up to date for the [latest stable release](/0.32 "0.32") of Crawl.*

**Chaotic** is an attribute that, among other things, makes a creature extremely susceptible to [silver](/Silver "Silver") weapons.

## Contents

- [1 Useful Info](#Useful_Info)
- [2 Chaotic monsters](#Chaotic_monsters)
- [3 Chaotic spells](#Chaotic_spells)
- [4 Chaotic gods](#Chaotic_gods)
- [5 Chaotic items](#Chaotic_items)

## Useful Info

Chaotic monsters are vulnerable to the [silver](/Silver "Silver") brand, taking 175% extra damage.

[Zin](/Zin "Zin") despises chaos, and worshippers who dare employ chaotic items or magic will find themselves undergoing [penance](/Penance "Penance"). Worshippers who leave to [Xom](/Xom "Xom") or [Jiyva](/Jiyva "Jiyva") will also incur [wrath](/Wrath "Wrath") (the other chaotic gods are [evil](/Evil "Evil") and upset all three [good gods](/Good_god "Good god"), including Zin). On the other hand, Zin will reward followers who slay chaotic monsters with additional piety.

Players can never be chaotic themselves, though they are considered "shapeshifted" during a [transformation](/Transformation "Transformation"), taking the same damage from silver weapons. Worshiping a chaotic god has no effect, if you have not worshipped Zin. Chaotic spells and items are similarly inconsequential, though the abilities of some may amuse [Xom](/Xom "Xom").

## Chaotic monsters

- [Shapeshifters](/Shapeshifter_\(monster\) "Shapeshifter (monster)"), all [ugly things](/Ugly_thing "Ugly thing"), [abominations](/Abomination "Abomination") [large](/Large_abomination "Large abomination") and [small](/Small_abomination "Small abomination"), [killer klowns](/Killer_Klown "Killer Klown"), [The Royal Jelly](/The_Royal_Jelly "The Royal Jelly"), [Tiamat](/Tiamat "Tiamat").
- A creature with innate "Mutate" or "Chaos" [attack flavours](/Attack_flavour "Attack flavour") (as opposed to simply having a [chaos](/Chaos "Chaos")-[branded](/Brand "Brand") weapon, like [Crazy Yiuf](/Crazy_Yiuf "Crazy Yiuf")).
- A creature having an intrinsic chaotic spell/ability, such as [Mnoleg](/Mnoleg "Mnoleg") (as opposed to simply casting chaos spells; spells with the wizard [spell slot flag](/Spell_slot_flags "Spell slot flags"), like [Kirke](/Kirke "Kirke")'s Porkalator, don't count).

## Chaotic spells

- [Banishment](/Banishment "Banishment")
- [Beastly Appendage](/Beastly_Appendage "Beastly Appendage")
- [Blade Hands](/Blade_Hands "Blade Hands")
- [Call of Chaos](/Call_of_Chaos "Call of Chaos")
- [Chain of Chaos](/Chain_of_Chaos "Chain of Chaos")
- [Dragon Form](/Dragon_Form "Dragon Form")
- [Ice Form](/Ice_Form "Ice Form")
- [Irradiate](/Irradiate "Irradiate")
- [Major Destruction](/Major_Destruction "Major Destruction")
- [Malign Gateway](/Malign_Gateway "Malign Gateway")
- [Malmutate](/Malmutate "Malmutate")
- [Necromutation](/Necromutation "Necromutation")
- [Polymorph](/Polymorph "Polymorph")
- [Porkalator](/Porkalator "Porkalator")
- [Spider Form](/Spider_Form "Spider Form")
- [Statue Form](/Statue_Form "Statue Form")
- [Storm Form](/Storm_Form "Storm Form")
- [Summon Horrible Things](/Summon_Horrible_Things "Summon Horrible Things")
- [Wereblood](/Wereblood "Wereblood")
- [Yara's Violent Unravelling](/Yara%27s_Violent_Unravelling "Yara's Violent Unravelling")

In addition, random [Hell](/Hell "Hell") effects are considered chaotic.

## Chaotic gods

- [Jiyva](/Jiyva "Jiyva")
- [Lugonu](/Lugonu "Lugonu")
- [Makhleb](/Makhleb "Makhleb")
- [Xom](/Xom "Xom")

## Chaotic items

- Weapons of [chaos](/Chaos "Chaos")
- Mutagenic [unrands](/Unrands "Unrands") or [randarts](/Randarts "Randarts"), like the [Plutonium Sword](/Plutonium_Sword "Plutonium Sword") or the [Glaive of Prune](/Glaive_of_Prune "Glaive of Prune")
- [Wands of polymorph](/Wands_of_polymorph "Wands of polymorph") and [pieces from Xom's chessboard](/Piece_from_Xom%27s_chessboard "Piece from Xom's chessboard")
- [Potions of mutation](/Potions_of_mutation "Potions of mutation") and [lignification](/Potion_of_lignification "Potion of lignification")
html:
Chaotic

From CrawlWiki
Jump to: navigation, search
Version 0.30: This article may not be up to date for the latest stable release of Crawl.

Chaotic is an attribute that, among other things, makes a creature extremely susceptible to silver weapons.

Contents

  • 1 Useful Info
  • 2 Chaotic monsters
  • 3 Chaotic spells
  • 4 Chaotic gods
  • 5 Chaotic items

Useful Info

Chaotic monsters are vulnerable to the silver brand, taking 175% extra damage.

Zin despises chaos, and worshippers who dare employ chaotic items or magic will find themselves undergoing penance. Worshippers who leave to Xom or Jiyva will also incur wrath (the other chaotic gods are evil and upset all three good gods, including Zin). On the other hand, Zin will reward followers who slay chaotic monsters with additional piety.

Players can never be chaotic themselves, though they are considered "shapeshifted" during a transformation, taking the same damage from silver weapons. Worshiping a chaotic god has no effect, if you have not worshipped Zin. Chaotic spells and items are similarly inconsequential, though the abilities of some may amuse Xom.

Chaotic monsters

  • Shapeshifters, all ugly things, abominations large and small, killer klowns, The Royal Jelly, Tiamat.
  • A creature with innate "Mutate" or "Chaos" attack flavours (as opposed to simply having a chaos-branded weapon, like Crazy Yiuf).
  • A creature having an intrinsic chaotic spell/ability, such as Mnoleg (as opposed to simply casting chaos spells; spells with the wizard spell slot flag, like Kirke's Porkalator, don't count).

Chaotic spells

  • Banishment
  • Beastly Appendage
  • Blade Hands
  • Call of Chaos
  • Chain of Chaos
  • Dragon Form
  • Ice Form
  • Irradiate
  • Major Destruction
  • Malign Gateway
  • Malmutate
  • Necromutation
  • Polymorph
  • Porkalator
  • Spider Form
  • Statue Form
  • Storm Form
  • Summon Horrible Things
  • Wereblood
  • Yara's Violent Unravelling

In addition, random Hell effects are considered chaotic.

Chaotic gods

  • Jiyva
  • Lugonu
  • Makhleb
  • Xom

Chaotic items

  • Weapons of chaos
  • Mutagenic unrands or randarts, like the Plutonium Sword or the Glaive of Prune
  • Wands of polymorph and pieces from Xom's chessboard
  • Potions of mutation and lignification

rawPage:
{{version030}}
'''Chaotic''' is an attribute that, among other things, makes a creature extremely susceptible to [[silver]] weapons.

==Useful Info==
Chaotic monsters are vulnerable to the [[silver]] brand, taking 175% extra damage.

[[Zin]] despises chaos, and worshippers who dare employ chaotic items or magic will find themselves undergoing [[penance]]. Worshippers who leave to [[Xom]] or [[Jiyva]] will also incur [[wrath]] (the other chaotic gods are [[evil]] and upset all three [[good god]]s, including Zin). On the other hand, Zin will reward followers who slay chaotic monsters with additional piety.

Players can never be chaotic themselves, though they are considered "shapeshifted" during a [[transformation]], taking the same damage from silver weapons. Worshiping a chaotic god has no effect, if you have not worshipped Zin. Chaotic spells and items are similarly inconsequential, though the abilities of some may amuse [[Xom]].

==Chaotic monsters==
*[[shapeshifter (monster)|Shapeshifter]]s, all [[ugly thing]]s, [[abomination]]s [[large abomination|large]] and [[small abomination|small]], [[Killer Klown|killer klown]]s, [[The Royal Jelly]], [[Tiamat]]. 
*A creature with innate "Mutate" or "Chaos" [[attack flavour]]s (as opposed to simply having a [[chaos]]-[[brand]]ed weapon, like [[Crazy Yiuf]]).
*A creature having an intrinsic chaotic spell/ability, such as [[Mnoleg]] (as opposed to simply casting chaos spells; spells with the wizard [[spell slot flags|spell slot flag]], like [[Kirke]]'s Porkalator, don't count).

==Chaotic spells==
*[[Banishment]]
*[[Beastly Appendage]]
*[[Blade Hands]]
*[[Call of Chaos]]
*[[Chain of Chaos]]
*[[Dragon Form]]
*[[Ice Form]]
*[[Irradiate]]
*[[Major Destruction]]
*[[Malign Gateway]]
*[[Malmutate]]
*[[Necromutation]]
*[[Polymorph]]
*[[Porkalator]]
*[[Spider Form]]
*[[Statue Form]]
*[[Storm Form]]
*[[Summon Horrible Things]]
*[[Wereblood]]
*[[Yara's Violent Unravelling]]

In addition, random [[Hell]] effects are considered chaotic.

==Chaotic gods==
*[[Jiyva]]
*[[Lugonu]]
*[[Makhleb]]
*[[Xom]]

==Chaotic items==
*Weapons of [[chaos]]
*Mutagenic [[unrands]] or [[randarts]], like the [[Plutonium Sword]] or the [[Glaive of Prune]]
*[[Wands of polymorph]] and [[piece from Xom's chessboard|pieces from Xom's chessboard]]
*[[Potions of mutation]] and [[potion of lignification|lignification]]
